result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle Allen Erbe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kyle Allen Erbe is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kyle Allen Erbe was found guilty of Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).
  • Kyle Allen Erbe was found guilty of Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Sign up for Probation on 10/11/22 by 04:00PM
- 2 days against ultimate sentence

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle Allen Erbe

records.addlTxt: e: DA, Atty Dolfi, and DOC    c: DE and SCSO. arc
e: DOC arc
$250.00 bond moved to 22CF72 from case 22CF434. arc
DE appeared out of court. DE to cont. to pay $50/mo due on 15th of each month.DE signed PPA. kef

2:33 PM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Kyle Allen Erbe in court.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Kyle Allen Erbe. INCLUDES 22CF72 and 22CF434. ADA Damrau recites agreement, amending Cts 1 and 3, Information forthcoming in 22CF72. DE sworn. WOPH in 22CF72: Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. PLEAS: DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 - Possession of Amphetamine and Ct 3 - Possession of Amphetamine in 22CF72. Court reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court finds DE knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives rights and makes plea. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 - Possession of Amphetamine and Ct 3 - Possession of Amphetamine in 22CF72. On motion of the State without objection, Court dismisses Ct 2 in 22CF72 and case 22CF434 in it's entirety. Sentencing arguments. Defendant advised of appeal rights. 

Court orders: 
22CF72
Ct 1 - Possession of Amphetamine
S/W 2 years probation with conditions:
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- Random testing at least one time per month by Agent
- Obtain full-time employment or school
- Court Costs $243; payable through Clerk of Court
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $200; payable through Clerk of Court

22CF72
Ct 3 - Possession of Amphetamine
S/W 2 years probation with conditions:
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- Random testing at least one time per month by Agent
- Obtain full-time employment or school
- Court Costs $243; payable through Clerk of Court
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $200; payable through Clerk of Court

2 days jail credit.
Apply bond on file, payment plan approved.
Defendant to report to probation no later than 4:00 PM today.

8:33 AM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Michelle P Brekken in court for State of Wisconsin, Defendant Kyle Allen Erbe in court, Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Kyle Allen Erbe. INCLUDES 22CF72 and 22CF434. Atty. Schutte will need to file withdrawal. Court reviews file. Atty. Dolfi states that discovery has been received, waives prelim time limits. Court sets SETC and PSC on both files. Atty. Dolfi requests DE to test at sober house rather than JSC. Court denies request. Bond continues. Adjourned: 8:40 AM. kma

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Dolfi; hereby appointing Atty Dolfi. arc
Status conference on July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

** AMENDED ** 

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing and ETG testing at least ONE time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must report to the Justice Support Center immediately. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

11:01 AM CO: Nordstrand, RPR: Sharesa M Campshure, Clerk: K Kittel.   ADA:  Michelle P Brekken   DF ATTY:  A.W. Schutte   DF:  Kyle Allen Erbe appeared.  Set for PLEAS. Atty Schutte states plea will not go today, noting DE's letter requesting new counsel.  DE makes statements as to request for new counsel, states he is unemployed, would like to qualify for PD. Court reviews record noting DE did qualify in February, in March DE returned and no longer qualified, PD office was waiting for documentation from DE. Court will not order the withdrawl of Atty Schutte until the DE contacts the PD's office. If qualifies, Atty Schutte will be filing to withdraw. Atty Brekken notes DE asked to be removed from testing conditions in his letter regarding testing.  Atty Brekken does not ojbect to modifying the testing. Court modifies testing to 1 time per week.  Adjourned:  11:15 am  Status conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
